item.title: Government webmail hacked via XSS bugs in global spy campaign
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are running a worldwide cyberespionage campaign dubbed 'RoundPress,' leveraging zero-day and n-day flaws in webmail servers to steal email from high-value government organizations. [...]

item.title: FBI: US officials targeted in voice deepfake attacks since April
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI warned that cybercriminals using AI-generated audio deepfakes to target U.S. officials in voice phishing attacks that started in April. [...]

item.title: Nova Scotia Power confirms hackers stole customer data in cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Nova Scotia Power confirms it suffered a data breach after threat actors stole sensitive customer data in a cybersecurity incident discovered last month. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 and Red Hat Linux hacked on first day of Pwn2Own
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: On the first day of Pwn2Own Berlin 2025, security researchers were awarded $260,000 after successfully demonstrating zero-day exploits for Windows 11, Red Hat Linux, Docker Desktop, and Oracle VirtualBox. [...]

item.title: New Tor Oniux tool anonymizes any Linux app's network traffic
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Tor has announced Oniux, a new command-line tool for routing any Linux application securely through the Tor network for anonymized network connections. [...]

item.title: Malicious NPM package uses Unicode steganography to evade detection
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A malicious package in the Node Package Manager index uses invisible Unicode characters to hide malicious code and Google Calendar links to host the URL for the command-and-control location. [...]

item.title: Coinbase data breach exposes customer info and government IDs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Coinbase, a cryptocurrency exchange with over 100 million customers, has disclosed that cybercriminals working with rogue support agents stole customer data and demanded a $20 million ransom not to publish the stolen information. [...]

item.title: Google fixes high severity Chrome flaw with public exploit
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google has released emergency security updates to patch a high-severity Chrome vulnerability that has a public exploit and can let attackers hijack accounts. [...]

item.title: Google Chrome to block admin-level browser launches for better security
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google is rolling out a change to Chromium that "de-elevates" Google Chrome so it does not run as an administrator to increase security in Windows. [...]

item.title: Hackers behind UK retail attacks now targeting US companies
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google warned today that hackers using Scattered Spider tactics against retail chains in the United Kingdom have also started targeting retailers in the United States. [...]

item.title: Ransomware gangs join ongoing SAP NetWeaver attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Ransomware gangs have joined ongoing SAP NetWeaver attacks, exploiting a maximum-severity vulnerability that allows threat actors to gain remote code execution on vulnerable servers. [...]

item.title: Australian Human Rights Commission leaks docs to search engines
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Australian Human Rights Commission (AHRC) disclosed a data breach incident where private documents leaked online and were indexed by major search engines. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Linux boot issues on dual-boot Windows systems
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has fixed a known issue preventing Linux from booting on dual-boot systems with Secure Boot enabled after installing the August 2024 Windows security updates. [...]
